title: Always difficulties using NSandI website with Firefox.
content: I am getting very frusrated logging onto and using the NSandI website using Firefox with Duck Duck Go. I always have to fill in the log in page twice, the first attempt always disappears after I get the"Authenticating your device" message; I have to accept cookies every step of the way and once I have eventually logged in to the site I have to accept cookies every time I move from one page to another in the website. I have tried clearing all history and have also completely removed and installed Firefox all to no avail. I contacted NSandI but they assure me the problem lies at my end and I am sure they are right because if I log on to the site using Chrome none of these problems arise. This is the only website I have such problems with when using Firefox/ Duck Duck Go which is my default browser. Can you assist me in finding a solution please rather than the obvious one of not using Firefox.
creator: grtate

title: Tab always crashes on audio playback
content:
I've had this problem for a couple of years already. Not with other browsers and, with the Internet Download Manager extension, I'm usually able to download multimedia content in FF. (That's been my workaround.)

For example, when loading this humble URL ... https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/transcoded/d/d8/Plattenknistern_record.ogg/Plattenknistern_record.ogg.mp3 ... if I have autoplay enabled, it'll crash right away ("Your tab just crashed"), without autoplay, it'll crash as soon as I hit play. Until a few days ago, no crash report was created under about:crashes, but, after upgrading to 112.0.1, I've finally been able to submit a crash report: bp-203a462b-e949-47b0-90f3-a99760230422

No difference if I create a new user profile and disable add-ons. Disabling hardware acceleration doesn't help either. I can't do without most of my settings and add-ons, so refreshing FF is not an option. I'd sooner try a new install (and then import my profile and reinstall add-ons), but that's laborious and not guaranteed to solve the problem.

(I've submitted this question before, about half a year ago - now archived -, but that didn't go anywhere for lack of crash diagnostics.)
creator: fucsi

title: Problemi con il login di Wordpress
content: Buongiorno. Ho un problema con l'accesso a Wordpress. Ieri ho aperto un account su wordpress.com. Tutto ok. Ho poi fatto il logout senza problemi. Oggi vado su wordpress.com, clicco in alto a destra su "accedi" e mi si apre una pagina bianca con al centro il logo "W" di Wordpress, senza la finestra di login nè alcuna altra possibilità di fare alcunchè. Ho provato e riprovato, ma niente. Ho provato anche a disattivare i componenti aggiuntivi di Firefox sia uno alla volta che tutti insieme: niente. Ho provato anche con la navigazione in anonimo: niente. Ho provato sul cell, e lì non c'è problema, la finestra di login si vede. Ho un Mac e uso Firefox. Per curiosità, ho provato anche con Safari, ma mi esce una pagina con la scritta "Il browser non supporta la pagina" (ma da Safari me lo aspettavo... ed è il motivo per cui non lo uso mai). Cosa posso fare? Grazie a chi mi vorrà aiutare.
creator: lube61

title: FF won't keep me loged into websites
content: I've been having trouble staying signed in on websites from Google (youtube, classroom & etc.) while using Firefox. I've tried everything from clearing cookies and allowing all cookies to reinstalling Firefox and removing all extensions, but the issue persists. I've also read other similar articles but they didn't work either. What steps can I take to fix this problem?
creator: k.dimoski980

title: Passwords are muddled between sites
content: This is crazy. I use FF both for Android and PC. I started realising that some passwords were for the wrong site. I have a different password for each website which I mentally compute. When I saw that websites weren't letting me in with saved passwords, I went to see the password manager and the saved password IS definitively one of my passwords, since it is in the right format, but certainly IS NOT for that website. It only happened for at least 3 websites, more like 5-6 (it started by me having to reset several passwords, which I never had to do before) so it could not possibly have been me saving a wrong password for a different site by mistake. I don't think it could be done even if I wanted to. I checked random entries in the password manager and all seem to be ok, except the ones I remembered were wrong. I think it is Firefox for Windows that is doing this, since one of these sites I access only from PC. But clearly, I can't be sure, since they synchronise across platforms. Most wierd that no one else complains about this problem. I can't think of how I could be doing this myself. Thanks for any help
creator: george195

title: Yeah..nah. Time to pull the ripcord.
content:
I came back to Firefox - which was my preferred browser for many years - because Chrome is a big fat memory hog, and would spend quite a while swapping pages into memory if it had been out of focus for a while. Opinions at the time varied widely, but suggested Firefox was more efficient.

Nope.. Firefox is at least as bad. And worse; it can't maintain a connection to Gmail which forces me to completely restart the browser every day. Mention this to Mozilla support and all you get from the devs is, "I don't experience this (on my high-end dev system) so it can't exist". Yeah, I'm running Firefox in the 2GB left over on my 8GB laptop - how hard can it be to write efficient code.. memory hog or slightly worse memory hog isn't much of a difference to me.

And of course I cant get the extensibility I used to have; and the constant pestering every-single-time the browser gets focus to do an upgrade. Going back to Chrome; though I expect things to get shaken up for the better soon enough (so over this old-skool grind with poorly functional, slow and unreliable software: bring on the AI)
creator: rwhitebrook

title: Duplex printing not available on default Firefox profile
content:
I have a Brother MFC-J53330DW printer, and cannot get the duplex printing feature to work on my computer since installing and selecting Firefox to be my default browser. It is a similar problem others have had in the past, and no solutions have come up that worked. I can print double-side/duplex in other browsers, and this feature used to work with firefox in the past. I updated the Brother drivers. Is there anyone who knows how to fix this issue? It seems like others have commented on it happening with other Brother printers with Firefox.

If you reference this question (Duplex printing not available on default Firefox profile) and others on the support site, the option does not show up in the print menu, or if using the system dialogue. Please help!
creator: write.isamel

title: Unable to live stream to Facebook using Zoom
content:
I am unable to live stream Zoom to Facebook using FireFox. I have attempted to live stream to my Facebook groups using Zoom many times. It never connects. Zoom opens a "Connect to Facebook" page that will not connect. I can copy the url into a different browser (Chrome, Edge, etc) and it works fine. I have cleared the cache, uninstalled and reinstalled Zoom, and the live stream fail continues.

Is there any way to fix this, or is FireFox going by by like its predecessor Netscape did?
creator: danielkilburn
